alert.note: Alert for Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:57PM EDT until July 12 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL ATLANTIC...SOUTH CENTRAL OCEAN AND SOUTHEASTERN BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 657 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pomona, or 8 miles northwest of Atlantic City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Atlantic City, Pleasantville, Somers Point, Ventnor City, Northfield, Absecon, Margate City, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Port Republic, Longport, Pomona, Wading River, New Gretna, Mystic Island and Linwood. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 31 and 54. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 3 and 16. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
